intro: Neololeba atra, commonly known as the black neololeba, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist forest environments. Neololeba atra is primarily of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
